description: Binomial coefficients C(n,k) such that C(n,k)-1 and C(n,k)+1 are twin primes and 2<=k<=floor(n/2).
comments: Sequence is ordered by size of n not size of C(n,k). Link gives list of all values up to n=1352.
example: C(11,5)=462 is a member of the sequence because 461 and 463 are twin primes.
mathematica: Select[Flatten[Table[Binomial[n,k],{n,200},{k,2,Floor[n/2]}]], AllTrue[ #+ {1,-1},PrimeQ]&] (* The program uses the AllTrue function from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Dec 10 2015 *)
crossrefs: See A051770 for values of n, A051771 for values of k.
author: Joe DeMaio (jdemaio(AT)kennesaw.edu), Dec 06 1999
extensions: More terms from _Harvey P. Dale_, Dec 10 2015
